content:
• Thursday, September 13, 2012
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) declared its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.25/share. Forward...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) declared its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.25/share. Forward yield 2.35%. For shareholders of record Sep 28. Payable Oct 15. Ex-div date Sep 26. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -2.1% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (ends Sep. 28) revenue of...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -2.1% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (ends Sep. 28) revenue of $3.9B-$4B, below prior guidance of $4.2B-$4.3B and a consensus of $4.33B. The company also forecasts the hard drive market will total 140M units in the quarter vs. prior guidance of 157M, no doubt due to poor PC demand. WDC is softening the blow by establishing a $0.25/share quarterly dividend (2.4% yield), and boosting its stock buyback program by $1.5B. STX -2.4%. LSI-OLD and MRVL down slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • WERN

    Werner Enterprises (NASDAQ:WERN) provides a disappointing Q3 forecast, now expecting earnings of...

    Werner Enterprises (NASDAQ:WERN) provides a disappointing Q3 forecast, now expecting earnings of $0.33 to $0.36 per share. Street expectations were for $0.44 per share. The trucking company said it was negatively impacted by cost increases for driver pay, rising fuel prices and higher equipment maintenance costs. "These costs are increasing faster than our revenue per mile," The company said in a statement. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) achieves a milestone of sorts, the stock moving above the price it closed at...

    JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) achieves a milestone of sorts, the stock moving above the price it closed at back on May 10 just before the London Whale trading loss was announced. The stock plunged about 24% in the weeks following, bottoming in early June right about the time the rest of the market set off on a big rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • XPER

    Tessera (TSRA) +5.7% after guiding for Q3 revenue of $66.5M-$69M, soundly above a $60M...

    Tessera (TSRA) +5.7% after guiding for Q3 revenue of $66.5M-$69M, soundly above a $60M consensus. Tessera's chip IP licensing business is expected to post revenue of $53M-$54M, nearly even with Q2's $53M. But its DigitalOptics unit, which provides camera modules and autofocus tech for mobile phones, is expected to see sales jump to $13.5M-$15M from Q2's $8.4M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • ALOG

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 0.58%. For shareholders of record Sep 27. Payable Oct 09. Ex-div date Sep 25. Shares +10.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ALOG

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG): FQ4 EPS of $1.32 beats by $0.51. Revenue of $151M (+12% Y/Y) beats by...

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG): FQ4 EPS of $1.32 beats by $0.51. Revenue of $151M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • RDA

    RDA Microelectronics (NASDAQ:RDA) declares special dividend of $0.20/share or $1.20/ADS. For...

    RDA Microelectronics (NASDAQ:RDA) declares special dividend of $0.20/share or $1.20/ADS. For shareholders of record Oct 01. Payable Oct 18. Ex-div date Sep 27. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • WLL

    The surge in Whiting Petroleum (WLL +4.6%) had started well before the QE news, on rumors the...

    The surge in Whiting Petroleum (WLL +4.6%) had started well before the QE news, on rumors the company will put itself up for sale. Adding fuel to the fire is today's option action, as nearly 5,400 Sept. $52.50 calls changed hands, well above open interest of less than 1,900 contracts. Potential suitors are said to include CVX, OXY, APA, RDS.A.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS +4%) spikes higher as Fortune's Dan Primack reports several P-E firms are eying...

    Staples (SPLS +4%) spikes higher as Fortune's Dan Primack reports several P-E firms are eying the office supplies chain. Among the firms is Bain Capital, which (as Mitt Romney reminds us) helped launch Staples in the '80s. Discussions are said to be preliminary, and no offer is expected before late this year "at the earliest." Primack notes Staples' strong cash flow and low valuation could make it an attractive P-E target, but its $8.1B market cap complicates matters.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TOT

    South Sudan apparently will split a massive oil block largely held by Total (TOT +1.8%) into...

    South Sudan apparently will split a massive oil block largely held by Total (TOT +1.8%) into three parts, giving one to the French company and the others to two firms - reportedly ExxonMobil (XOM +2%) and Kuwait Petroleum - in the biggest shakeup of the country's concessions since it seceded from Sudan.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • AXN

    Shares of Aoxing Pharmaceutical (AXN +17%) have shot up in afternoon trading on no particular...

    Shares of Aoxing Pharmaceutical (AXN +17%) have shot up in afternoon trading on no particular news. The company declined comment, after being contacted by the NYSE Euronext in accordance with the usual practice.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • ANRZQ

    "Recoverable world coal reserves are the longest life (R/P ratio) of any fossil fuel - the go-to...

    "Recoverable world coal reserves are the longest life (R/P ratio) of any fossil fuel - the go-to BTU in any return to global growth," Gregor McDonald writes. Thus QE bulls are pushing coal sector stocks (KOL +3.5%) near the top of today's top gainers: ANR +11.8%, ACI +8.5%, CLF +6.3%, WLT +5.2%, CLD +4%, CNX +3.1%, BTU +2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 120 Comments
  • RGDX

    Response Genetics (OTC:RGDX +33.3%) ramps higher today after it announced earlier that it...

    Response Genetics (OTC:RGDX +33.3%) ramps higher today after it announced earlier that it entered into a purchase agreement with GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1.7%) and one of its existing significant stockholders to raise $8.8M from the private placement of 8M newly issued shares at $1.10 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • UTX

    United Technologies (UTX +2.2%) CEO Louis Chenevert tells analysts share buybacks of up to $1B...

    United Technologies (UTX +2.2%) CEO Louis Chenevert tells analysts share buybacks of up to $1B will resume in 2013, more than a year after repurchases were suspended during the Goodrich acquisition. Chenevert says UTX will not make any more large purchases, focusing instead on smaller deals costing a total of $1B next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • HES

    The overall breadth of the market's strength today takes Hess (HES +2.2%) higher, despite being...

    The overall breadth of the market's strength today takes Hess (HES +2.2%) higher, despite being cut to Hold this morning by Standpoint Research. The stock is up 29% since the firm upped to a Buy back in July, and, with such a rich valuation, Standpoint can no longer justify a Buy rating so close to its price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • NEM

    Comex gold rose 2.2% to $1,772.10/oz. to finish near seven-month highs on the Fed's QE3...

    Comex gold rose 2.2% to $1,772.10/oz. to finish near seven-month highs on the Fed's QE3 announcement, and gold miners (GDX +4.3%) are performing even better: NEM +5.4%, ABX +3.5%, GFI +3.8%, GG +4.9%, FCX +3.9%. Silver spiked even more, and silver miners (SIL +6.8%) are soaring too: SLW +5.1%, HL +5.3%, PAAS +4.8%, CDE +6.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 12 Comments

  • Skullcandy (SKUL -12.2%) gets pummeled by a downgrade to Equalweight from Morgan Stanley. The...

    Skullcandy (SKUL -12.2%) gets pummeled by a downgrade to Equalweight from Morgan Stanley. The headphone maker, which is closing in on its post-IPO low, fell a bit yesterday after Apple gave the earbuds that ship with iPhones and iPods a needed refresh.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM

  • Mindspeed (MSPD +4.6%) jumps after Raymond James starts coverage with an Outperform and $3.50...

    Mindspeed (MSPD +4.6%) jumps after Raymond James starts coverage with an Outperform and $3.50 target. The chipmaker has been posting losses as it struggles to deal with weak telecom capex and competition from bigger rivals. It's hoping the purchase of femtocell base station chip developer PicoChip will help spark a turnaround. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • CRTX

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (CRTX -17%) shares plunge after an FDA advisory panel votes against...

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (CRTX -17%) shares plunge after an FDA advisory panel votes against approval of lixivaptan for the treatment of low sodium levels in the blood associated with heart failure. Shares resumed trading at 2:00 after a halt at the open.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM

  • Nuance (NUAN +2.9%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley starts coverage at Overweight. Nuance,...

    Nuance (NUAN +2.9%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley starts coverage at Overweight. Nuance, which has rallied strongly off its July lows, recently scored a deal to have its voice-assistant software build into Intel's ultrabook platform. Its software also helps power Apple's Siri, which is getting a facelift next week when iOS 6 arrives.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • MM

    Many companies with strong mobile exposure, including some Apple rivals, are outperforming a day...

    Many companies with strong mobile exposure, including some Apple rivals, are outperforming a day after the iPhone 5 launch. MM +4.2%. VELT +2%. P +3.9%. RIMM +1.6%. NOK +6.4%. QCOM +2%. Is this just a case of sector rotation at work?
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • CUR

    Shares of microcap biotech firm Neuralstem (CUR +42%) are soaring today, after it says its...

    Shares of microcap biotech firm Neuralstem (CUR +42%) are soaring today, after it says its neural stem cells were featured as part of a published study in the scientific journal Cell. In the study, paraplegic rats with surgically transected spinal cords recovered significant locomotor function after being transplanted with CUR's spinal cord stem cells. The transplanted cells turned into neurons which grew a "remarkable" number of axons that extended for "very long distances."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK +8.2%) continues to pile on big gains enjoyed since its Sept. 4 deal to acquire...

    Heckmann (HEK +8.2%) continues to pile on big gains enjoyed since its Sept. 4 deal to acquire Power Fuels, giving HEK a foothold in the Bakken Shale. The move was bolstered earlier this week with the addition of a water treatment service in the Marcellus Shale. Shares are up 81% this month, approaching $5 for the first time since March.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 9 Comments

  • More on UBS' upgrade of Jive Software (JIVE +2.8%): Analyst Brent Thill touts the fact Jive...

    More on UBS' upgrade of Jive Software (JIVE +2.8%): Analyst Brent Thill touts the fact Jive (market cap of $901.8M) is worth less than the $1.2B Microsoft paid for rival Yammer. He also likes Jive's sales investments, dismisses competitive threats as "overblown," believes macro and forex headwinds are temporary, and thinks Jive's shares have seen "undeserved collateral damage" from crashing consumer social networking valuations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • EADSY

    Citigroup and Deutsche both weigh in on Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -10.5%), with Citi downgrading the...

    Citigroup and Deutsche both weigh in on Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -10.5%), with Citi downgrading the shares to Neutral and Deutsche cutting it to hold over the potential risks associated with a BAE (OTCPK:BAESY -7.7%) merger. Analysts for both firms see big hurdles to the potential tie-up. Citi cites a high valuation, as well as euro concerns and BAE's defense-heavy focus. Deutsche points to integration risks, saying that cross-border mergers, especially in Europe, are extremely difficult to manage.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM

  • Zynga (ZNGA -3.9%) is giving back some of the gains it saw on account of Mark Zuckerberg's talk....

    Zynga (ZNGA -3.9%) is giving back some of the gains it saw on account of Mark Zuckerberg's talk. In addition to the recent avalanche of defections, concerns about the early uptake for FarmVille 2 (previous) have been weighing on investors. AppData claims the game's daily and monthly active users are still only at 300K and 680K, respectively. Jefferies recently argued anything less than 5M daily users would be disappointing, and that 20M would be needed for FarmVille 2 to be considered a "home run."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • NOC

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -2.8%) slips on a downgrade to Sell on valuation at UBS this morning,...

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -2.8%) slips on a downgrade to Sell on valuation at UBS this morning, citing concerns over it's outsized exposure to a declining U.S. defense budget. As our military commitments draw down globally, the looming fiscal cliff debate puts it squarely against cuts to hot point programs like Medicare coverage, Social Security benefits and safety net programs for the poor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • PDS

    Precision Drilling (PDS +2.2%) is upgraded to Outperform with a target price range of $11-$12,...

    Precision Drilling (PDS +2.2%) is upgraded to Outperform with a target price range of $11-$12, up from $7-$8, by Wells Fargo. The stock offers an attractive risk-reward entry point, the firm says, between a new primary uptrend's first leg - the late June through early August surge on oil's rebound and valuation - and its second, which will be driven by Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +4.8%) shares rip higher on a report that China is reducing rare earth mining...

    Molycorp (MCP +4.8%) shares rip higher on a report that China is reducing rare earth mining licenses by 40%. The number of licenses had been 113, according to Securities Journal. The news is seen as positive for companies holding existing licenses as future competition may now be limited. Also on the move: REE +3.4%, AVL +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 5 Comments
  • BIOF

    BioFuel Energy (BIOF +27.7%) shares are spiking after David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital...

    BioFuel Energy (BIOF +27.7%) shares are spiking after David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital discloses a 36.2% beneficial interest via an amended 13D filing, up from 35.9% last reported in April 2011. Einhorn's entities bought 69,382 shares in the last 60 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM

  • Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.3%) show no ill effect from a SEC filing that reveals Jana...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.3%) show no ill effect from a SEC filing that reveals Jana Partners dumped its sizable entire stake in the company. Though the overall trend has been decidedly downward, the company still has its shares of bulls - especially with plans over the MSFT-BKS venture still not fully revealed. (Related: SA author Alex Shadunksy makes the case to buy BKS)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • SODA

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +0.5%) break higher with fresh chatter out that the company could be...

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +0.5%) break higher with fresh chatter out that the company could be a takeover candidate. Though Kraft, Coca-Cola and PepsiCo are routinely trotted out as the leading candidates to snap up the beverage machine maker, as a global target and with SODA's market cap still below the $1B mark the list of potential buyers is much longer with a sleeper or two included.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 5 Comments
  • NDZ

    Nordion (NDZ +1.8%) shakes up its management structure as the medical-technology company says it...

    Nordion (NDZ +1.8%) shakes up its management structure as the medical-technology company says it will realign its operations into two distinct business units with separate corporate structures: Targeted Therapies and Specialty Isotopes. The Company also appoints Jeff Brown, CEO and founding member of Brown Equity Partners, to its Board of Directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI -13.6%) takes a hit after pricing its offering of 8M units at $4...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI -13.6%) takes a hit after pricing its offering of 8M units at $4 each, a 12% discount to yesterday's close. The units each include one share of common stock and a warrant to purchase 0.35 of a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY -1.3%) is downgraded to Underperform (Sell) at Macquarie. No details are yet...

    Annaly (NLY -1.3%) is downgraded to Underperform (Sell) at Macquarie. No details are yet available, but here's a preview: Exposure to the flattish yield curve and prepayment risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 15 Comments

  • "The business fell off. The CEO was too confident in the business. I don't like the stock, and...

    "The business fell off. The CEO was too confident in the business. I don't like the stock, and I'm not going to recommend it." Those comments from Jim Cramer, made during yesterday's Mad Money broadcast, are enough to produce a selloff in Frontier (FTR -2.5%). Shares have mostly tread water in recent weeks after taking off on a better-than-expected Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • STNG

    Global Hunter says shipping is "still afloat in troubled waters," believing companies with low...

    Global Hunter says shipping is "still afloat in troubled waters," believing companies with low leverage, modern fleets and experienced management should outperform the sector over the long term. The firm initiates coverage with at Buy for Scorpio Tankers (STNG +0.2%) and Tsakos Energy (TNP +3%). Starting at Accumulate: SFL. Neutral: NNA, OSG. Reduce: NAT.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • DUSA-OLD

    Dusa Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:DUSA-OLD) Levulan treatment for the skin condition actinic...

    Dusa Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:DUSA-OLD) Levulan treatment for the skin condition actinic keratoses performs well in Phase 2 trials. Often called "sun spots," actinic keratoses are scaly patches on the skin caused by excessive exposure to ultraviolet light and can lead to cancer. Shares +4.3% but were much higher premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • EQIX

    The Equinix (EQIX +13%) board approves a plan to convert the company to a REIT in order to...

    The Equinix (EQIX +13%) board approves a plan to convert the company to a REIT in order to "maximize long-term shareholder value." CEO Steve Smith notes several competitors in the data center industry have done the same. The company expects to elect REIT status for the taxable year beginning Jan. 1, 2015. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) +12.5% premarket after announcing it has licensed Takeda...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) +12.5% premarket after announcing it has licensed Takeda Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:TKPHF, TKPYY.PK) to market Vitaros, its erectile dysfunction drug, in the U.K. Takeda will pay APRI an undisclosed upfront payment and milestone payments of up to 35M euros.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • USG

    Building material names (possibly far ahead of true housing recovery) are set to take a hit as...

    Building material names (possibly far ahead of true housing recovery) are set to take a hit as heavy-hitter Ivy Zelman reportedly downgrades USG Corp. to Sell, Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) to sell, and Owens Corning (NYSE:OC) to hold. USG -4.3% premarket, OC -2% premarket. (h/t Marc Lehman)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower ahead of the FOMC's policy announcement later, when...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower ahead of the FOMC's policy announcement later, when the Fed is expected to unveil more stimulus, if not QE3 itself. Is it a case of buy the rumor and sell the news before the news has been made? The S&P benchmark is -0.1%. Later: Consumer comfort, Fed's Sarah Raskin
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 9 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) +4.2% on an upgrade to Buy from UBS. The company, which went public...

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) +4.2% on an upgrade to Buy from UBS. The company, which went public to a rich valuation late last year, closed yesterday near its post-IPO lows. Many see it as a buyout target, particularly after Microsoft/Yammer, but as an independent company, it's dealing with intensifying competition - IBM rolled out a major update to its Jive competitor yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • VICL

    Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) +14% premarket after announcing Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) has licensed...

    Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) +14% premarket after announcing Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) has licensed its patented platform DNA immunization technology to generate antibodies with potential therapeutic uses in humans on a non-exclusive, worldwide basis. Financial terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • EQIX

    Premarket gainers: EQIX +14%. VICL +13%. APRI +13%. LRN +10%. PLL-OLD +7%. CTIC +5%. Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: EQIX +14%. VICL +13%. APRI +13%. LRN +10%. PLL-OLD +7%. CTIC +5%.
    Losers: CCRT -29%. PSTI -17%. FMER -7%. USG -6%. HK -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • LIVE

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) shoot up 7.5% premarket after the company brings Skype's former...

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) shoot up 7.5% premarket after the company brings Skype's former head of business development on board. Perry Teevens will be responsible for strategic partnerships in his newly formed position of Senior Vice President Business Development.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -4.6% premarket on top of yesterday's 11% swoon, as the 35M-share...

    Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -4.6% premarket on top of yesterday's 11% swoon, as the 35M-share secondary offering is priced at $7/share. HK will not sell any shares or receive any proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD) +7.8% premarket after yesterday's strong FQ4 earnings report included a...

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD) +7.8% premarket after yesterday's strong FQ4 earnings report included a forecast calling for EPS to grow in a yearly range of 9%-16%, implying adjusted profit of $3.05-$3.25/share. For FY 2012, PLL generated pro-forma earnings from continuing operations of $2.80/share, up 16% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM

  • European shares are broadly flat to lower as investors await the FOMC later today. BAE Systems...

    European shares are broadly flat to lower as investors await the FOMC later today. BAE Systems is -5.1% and EADS -7.3% following news of their merger talks yesterday. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.5%, London +0.1%, Paris -0.5%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Milan -0.9%, Madrid -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 AM

  • Asian shares are flat-to-higher as investors await the FOMC's decision on whether to provide...

    Asian shares are flat-to-higher as investors await the FOMC's decision on whether to provide more stimulus. Apple component suppliers have had a mixed day following the launch of the iPhone 5, with TDK and Murata Manufacturing rising in Tokyo but LG Display and SK Hynix falling in South Korea. Japan +0.4%, Hong Kong +0.3%, China -0.1%, India +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 AM
